post_content:
Beautiful necklace in Sterling silver with a Turkish eye hanger.

A Turkish eye, also known as nazar, is a trinket with the shape of a flat drop where the figure of an eye is found, which is attributed protective forces, and which is widely used as a talisman or amulet against evil eye and bad energies. . It is very common in Greece and there it is known as the Greek eye and is used against the negative influence of envy

post_content:
Traditional used in Morocco on pastries and other cooking dishes also used as a Room or bath scent and also is very refreshing as a facial toner. 
Rose Water is made using roses and a steam distillation process.
The resulting fragrant water has found its way into many culinary uses in Moroccan cuisine and beauty product. 
Rose Water is used in a variety of Moroccan and Mediterranean cooking
Rose Water can be used in a facial mask.
Add Rose Water to your bath water.
Spray Rose Water as a moisturizer after your bath.

Rose Water can be used as a face lotion for all skin types to tone
Imported from Lebanon

post_title: “GARDEN PLEASURES HIDEAWAY” By Jerianne Van Dijk
post_content:
Jerianne Van Dijk is an artist whose works cover a wide array of subjects. 

Her works can be classified as both realist and impressionist.  She uses different media for her works, including watercolor, crayons, and gouache. 

She gives every process of her work the much needed attention to ensure that she gets the right results in terms of mood and color. 

Her three main areas of work are watercolor paintings, murals, and illustrations, which she basically does for different publications.

post_content:
Great Condition Fabrice de Villeneuve Stretched Canvas Rare Art Print Cafe de Flore Tour Eiffel  Boulevard Saint Michel , Small Damage behind top and front edge of canvas frame.

The romance and nostalgia of Paris and greater France comes alive via Fabrice De Villeneuve's art. Born in France, De Villeneuve led a charmed childhood, growing up amid gardens by the sea, later selling artifacts as an antique dealer which profoundly affected the direction of his art. Epitomizing the charming ambiance of France's yesteryear, his style encompasses trompe-l'oeil, florals and interior scenes that exude the warm allure of past eras. De Villeneuve's work has been featured in many international design publications.

post_title: Rare Jan Dorer Mid-Century Artist Watercolor Art Signed Numbered 14/250
post_content:
Beautiful and Rare Jan Dorer Mid-Century Artist Watercolor Art Signed and Numbered, with some research found its name “Tranquil Snow”

Pencil signed

Numbered 14//250

Used framed art with some dark spots and black dots due to age, brown paper on back is ripped. Artwork in great condition.


Jen Dorer a resident of Michigan until 1972 moved to Kennesaw Georgia with her husband and two children. they now enjoy a studio home in the country just north of Atlanta. A graduate of Central Michigan she holds a BS degree with a measure in art. her style often referred to as unique and fresh, she has been personally developed through years of painting experimentation and a compulsion to share both of herself and her work with others.

Her creativity by its nature it’s always expanding into new forms shapes colors and feelings. Whether a watercolor, or an acrylic a Jen Dorer painting Evolves from an idea or mood and communications with feeling a sensitive, private message to Its beholder.



Let us pause for a moment in snowy silence to feel the warmth , know the wonder and share the love of the season.


11 1/2 W x 9 1/2” H
